alert.note: Alert for Covington; Jefferson Davis; Lamar; Marion (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 8:54AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Marion, Covington, northwestern Lamar and southern Jefferson Davis Counties through 930 AM CDT... At 854 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Lone Star to near Society Hill to near Tilton. Movement was east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Bunker Hill and Lone Star around 900 AM CDT. Collins around 905 AM CDT. Columbia and Melba around 910 AM CDT. Sumrall and Sanford around 915 AM CDT. Improve around 920 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bassfield and Seminary. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
